title: The best app I never knew I needed
text: Title describes it all basically, I’m guilty of constantly shopping online and everyday multiple times a day I check my email to see my shipping statuses. When I started seeing the option to stay updated with arrive after checkout on online stores I decided to download it and it’s been a go to every day since. Basically you log in with your email you like to make orders with on the app and it will filter out all your emails and will only show your online orders that have tracking information. it will show you a updated tracking status with a transit map status as well, it shows what’s happening with your order as it’s updated without going to your email and searching every time. Very convenient if you're the type who likes to know exactly when your packages are shipped and updated. Thank you (maybe add a more colorful theme to the menus$

title: ⭐️Very CONVENIENT!⭐️
text:
I am so glad I found this app! 
You literally connect your email(s) account(s) to it and it pulls info from there (shipment notification, emails) and puts all the information in one spot for you! 
It saves you from having to search for the email that has all the information, from things you ordered, etc. 

⭐️ I only give 4 stars because I wish it would allow other email providers other than just gmail. 
I have Gmail email addresses AND yahoo. I also use Microsoft email from time to time. 
So that’s my BIGGEST problem with this app. Which isn’t huge, but it would be 1000% convenient if you would allow Yahoo(and other email) email accounts to be added so I/everyone could track through those email accounts as well! 

ALSO!! Every now and then, it’s a little behind on the updates from USPS, UPS or FEDEX. 
I have all of those apps and sometimes I’ll get a new shipping notification from one of the above, before Arrive gives me the notification. Or sometimes USPS (for example) will give me a new update on my shipment, long before Arrive ever reports any changes. 
IF this happens, Arrive will eventually update and give me the notification of a change, but it just kind of drags on the notifications/updates from time to time. 
That’s not a huge deal, but I thought y’all might want to know in case it were something you would like to fix! 

Thank you for this app!!

title: Inaccurate
text:
Updates are late or don’t happen at all. I can look at status on carrier website and have more updates than this app. Even refreshing the app or the package the updates don’t come through for hours. You can’t edit a carrier either so packages that go from ups to USPS require you to delete the package and re add it under the new carrier. 

Edit: tried to give this app another chance and still not change. To add my list, there’s no estimated arrival date! What is the point of knowing my package is in my state if I don’t know when it will be delivered? Often times packages get held up due to smart post so I can never assume that just because it’s local that it will be delivered in a timely fashion. What’s the point of the app if I have to copy and paste the shipping into the carrier website for an estimated delivery date?

The UI is cluttered. It often missing tracking info from emails. Gives less details than similar apps. For example when I plug in a new tracking number into this app before it’s shipped other apps will tell me where the shipping label was created. This app? Nothing, just says it’s waiting for data.

title: What you look for and expect from a tracker
text: Since I e started using this app shop in 2019, I believe it was then called arrive. Either way, I have only downloaded this app once and the rest is history lol!! I a man whom is ordering new parts, new big boy toys, as well as the resent outbreak lockdown that’s increased the amount of online shopping I do. This here app has been my package tracker every time with an average 2-3 orders monthly, exactly what you expect and look for with various additional perks giving us consumers the most optimal package tracking system/services in your pocket! Get it now and track your packages. Of course read your purchases carefully as you can’t track an order if your supplier aka website your making your purchase from does not offer tracking. So make sure you make purchases from people and businesses that offer tracking.

title: Not accurate, provides no way to cancel your account.
text: I downloaded this app because a certain vendor offered tracking information through it. Tracking information here has been, in my experience, almost useless. It's easier and quicker and more accurate to go through the post office. For example, I had a package that Shop app said was going to be delivered yesterday, even though the post office said it wasn't. Of course it was not delivered, and today the app tells me it's going to be delivered today. It is not, because there is no post office delivery today. This is not just a single time problem, I have experienced this in the past. I also don't like the way that they try to sell you stuff. If I want to buy some thing, I'll go through the merchant, not some third-party app with sketchy privacy policies. Further, there doesn't seem to be any way to cancel the account so that they don't have my information. I have deleted the app, but I'm still trying to find a way to actually cancel my account so they don't keep scarfing up my buying information.

title: Used to be helpful, updates made it worse
text: This used to be my main tracking app. It was useful because before it would show all your tracking and where they were on a map. Great to know how far along things are! Then, it updated. You had to go to a separate tab to view them, which was an annoying extra step but whatever, got used to it. My app automatically updated without me wanting it to, and now they’re all progress bars. Why? This is horrible and not helpful at all. If I want to see where a package is, I have to go view all orders, tap the order, and then tap the show details to see the map. Then, back out, back out, and do it all over again with the next package. Horrible if you have multiple items to keep an eye on. New update made the app itself not worth using anymore. Might be a good shopping app, I don’t know though as I got it specifically for the tracking. It’s fine if you want your app to be more for that, but please don’t change and remove features that are needed :’)

title: Hesitated to download, but now I love it.
text:
As someone who now lives in a building where I’ve experienced package theft, I really value an app like this. It makes it easy to see the status of pretty much all my non-Amazon packages in one place. This has also encouraged me to reach out to support when shipping is lagging because I’m more aware of where my orders are, and this has really benefitted me. 

On top of this I have come to feel a sense of relief when I notice the purple Shop button in a stores online checkout. I appreciate the auto fill and trust that the transaction will be processed safely, the same way I would PayPal. Not to mention I love the promise of carbon neutral shipping. 

My only qualm with this app is that I started receiving unsolicited emails. I never signed up for them, and Shop is basically encouraging me to look at products directly through the Shop app.

title: The most essential app for online shopping
text: This app is very good with tracking and delivery, it can search through your email to look for a tracking number for something you bought when you can’t find it, it shows you real time locations of where your package is at and it gives you the websites of what you purchased so you can look through and shop more if you’d like. This app is really nice because I’ve ordered a shirt off of a website and it took 3 months to get to my house and it tracked my package no matter what, this app is genius and highly underrated for what it’s worth. For anyone who frequently or regularly buys things online, it’s always a comfort knowing when and where your package is going to arrive, and best believe you’ll feel comfortable and satisfied using Shop to guide your purchases to your doorstep. 10/10

title: Shop With Confidence
text: I’ve been using SHOP for the last few months especially when I started holiday shopping. It started as an accident but turned out to be a really happy accident. I am able to automatically pull my purchases into that app and it allows me to see each and every purchase from each and every website, the individual items, the expected delivery dates along with linking link tracking links provided as soon as they are available. It keeps things very simple and since they pull automatically, very rarely do you purchase some thing where you need to watch it in a different way. I would highly recommend this to anyone who does even moderate shopping throughout the year. This is probably one of the best apps for shopping to keep things straight I’ve seen in years! Five stars from me.

title: Easy and Helpful.
text: I opened the app. I logged in my email. I was shookth at how all my shipments I had just ordered was listed with arrivals and updates. I haven’t needed to input or lookup any more information ever since. It automatically detected packages that I order.(Most of the time, naming them for me so I know what is what.) It can send notifications for all your packages and update you on each step it takes. It’s pretty interesting looking at all the routes your packages take.(not important but cool) It has extra stuff like telling you the means of transportation, or contacting the seller so if you see something alarming instantly go to where you need to go. It sends you to a email or website from the app. The only recommendation is that if you’re lazy like me the old delivered packages stay and build up. I wish there was a way select multiple packages to archived/delete/show as delivered all at once.

title: Better Than I Hoped!
text: I saw a lot of mixed reviews and a lot of it seemed like impatient people or folks who got mad because they didn’t get the big “jackpot” set in the mystery box’s. Well I can confidently say you can ignore all that nonsense. I’ve had to talk to customer service and they were incredibly quick and kind. They shipped my order very quickly and when it finally got here there was no disappointment. The print and quality of these figures, even the accessories and sets are really something to behold! I think the designers should be proud of their work! If you want high quality custom figures you’ll love, then look no further. If you have to wait a little while for an order just be patient this is a small group of people just doing what they love the best they can and they surely get swamped with orders. I promise it’s worth the wait!

title: Where has this been all my life?
text: A costuming website I used for a piece of my halloween costume this year suggested I use this app to track my package, and I figured I’d give it a shot...but OH BABY wow. Its tracks anything and everything I order through my e-mail, so tracking any package I order from anywhere has become EFFORTLESS. With buggy sites that seemed to practically not even register the tracking numbers they’re supposed to be provide you info through (looking at you UPS) this is mind blowing to me. Where has this app been all of my life, why haven’t I heard of it before, and why did I find out about it through such an obscure niche site? Thank you whoever created this app for making my life lightyears easier, I wish I had this app a month earlier when there was a miscommunication about my street address for an important time sensitive package, would have saved me a lot of headache.

title: Beware Shop Pay
text:
First, the shop app is ok. Maybe 3 stars worth. It picks up a lot of packages but often misses things, and doesn’t update as quickly as the carrier’s information, but it does conveniently track packages.

I cannot recommend against Shop Pay or Affirm strongly enough. There are so many bugs on the app and website making it impossible to make a payment. Then even when I was able to get support in a chat to make try to make a payment, they would not just run my card for me, even though they have all the available information; they gave me another number to call. And they talked to me the entire time like I was a criminal, or someone trying to avoid paying a bill, when making a payment was the exact reason I contacted them! This was an exhausting amount of work to put into trying to make a payment.

So this app is ok for tracking packages, but due to the many bugs in the UI preventing payment and the complete lack of empathy by their support staff, I would definitely not trust this company with my credit card information.

title: Used to be good
text: I used to use this app almost religiously. And it was so handy! Minutes after I’d order something, I’d here the ‘ding ding’ of the app saying new order found and from there I’d be able to essentially watch my package travel from origin to me. I’ve had this app since ‘19. However, in the last few minutes it’s started to lag a little bit. The product whereabouts info would necessarily add up - the app would say it’s in this place, while actual shipping info from carrier said it was in that place. Sometimes the info on the app wouldn’t even update until my item got delivered. And now they either did some sort of update or something because I was kicked off the app and told to re-login. Upon getting back into the app, none of the purchased I’ve made in the last year and a half were showing, only things from ‘19. After being told to “clear your phones cache, and redownload the app”, I still couldn’t see my recent purchases. Guess that’s my cue to leave the app behind.

title: The best!!!! Gorgeous and Comfy all the way!!!
text: This company is awesome. From the color, comfort and quality of the contact lenses to the customer service, this company rocks!! The lenses are soft, and thin, with FDA approved pigment and are easy to put in and remove and come with a crystal clear lens case. One of the best things about ordering from this company is that for each eye your can have a different prescription and the two different Left eye and  Right eye strength as is often the case me!)comes as a set, as oppose to having to order two separate orders which will double the cost. You’ll also get a free set of lenses for each pair you order! Can’t go wrong with that! It does take about three weeks to arrive in your mailbox but they are worth the wait! If you’re on the fence, order from this company. They’re amazing and the colors actually show on your eyes the way it’s advertised. Get it, girls & boys!!💖💖💖

title: Shipping and handling
text: First the shipping of the two shirts I bought took almost a month and through the shop app. It took forever for updates and when it was getting processed. 2nd the day it finally arrived I didn’t know it made it to my location until I got home. 3rd one of my shirt has a hole in the under arm area of the sleeve. 4th on one of my shirts the sleeves were entirely too big. You could basically fit two of my arms in each sleeve. 5th the designs on the shirt were advertised totally different from what I saw what was posted on Instagram. The designs were more of a shiney coating while it was advertised on Instagram, the designs were more incorporated in the material not like the iron/press on design it went for. One of the shirts fit better for the other. 30$ was worth the price, especially when it was already reduced and my clothes were damaged in the process. Be weary when shopping off if these online stores. One shirt fit perfectly while the other looked like it was worn by Victor Kraven.

title: Useless
text:
Shop is literally useless as an order processor / tracker. I ordered something through a website that uses Shop to perform these functions, and Shop pulled in a stale address for me. I accidentally confirmed the order, which is on me, but I immediately recognized my mistake afterwards. 

First I thought “No biggie, I’m sure I can still edit delivery details.” No dice. So I see the confirmation email from Shop come through, which was really just an ad for this app, so I download it thinking I’ll have luck here. Nope! Even “deep linking” from subsequent emails from Shop containing order numbers into the Shop app was a dead end—those links opened prior orders that were pulled in from my email account. In fact, the Shop app hadn’t even “pulled in” the order yet. Believe it or not, the app wouldn’t pull in the order until a full day after the order had shipped—obviously long after I could’ve changed a delivery address. 

This app is useless. Both as a tracking app (it can’t even stay up-to-date on orders placed through your Shop account!) and as a payment processor.

title: Meh
text: Various online sites that I order from have asked me to download this app to track my purchases. So I did… so I can track my purchases. It used to be an ok app, albeit slow about updating its tracking information; however after updating the app, it has since been completely overhauled. I don’t like the current interfaces focus on store advertising moreso than the tracking of my packages— which is the reason why I downloaded this app in the first place. I don’t want store advertisements all over my app. If I have to be bombarded with ads, then please incorporate a way to filter out the stores that have nothing to do with my purchases or purchase history. I’m a man— I don’t need advertising on women’s clothing and lipstick!!! Adding online store fronts within the app made tracking less of a focus, all while connecting you with shops that are unrelated to your purchases and interests, and making them the new primary focus. I rarely use this app now… even for tracking my purchases. I hope this helps.

title: SOC knife take down mat GITD
text: I haven’t been in the edc game long, but I gotta say that by far out of any company I have dealt with so far, you guys have the best customer service and group of employees. That’s one of the many reasons I fully support everything you guys do, and even though this upcoming Nemley drop is the first preorder I have ever been apart of, let alone the only one that’s been available since I found you guys. I plan on Hopfully being apart of every upcoming preorder opportunity! I truly hope to one day be able to afford a blade made by the man Felix himself in shop, weather if he a fixed blade or a folder! I would truly fulfill my “grail” as they call it if I could get a blade made by Felix! Such an awesome company and am so glad to be apart of it and watch this company grow!! Much love guys! Thanks for the awesome stuff you provide us with!!

title: At first I was like “why?”   Fix the part that only looks at yahoo and not gmail.
text:
After reading how they plant trees and it was no skin off my neck to download a free app. This app has been updated a couple times with worthwhile addons, so the devs are paying attention here, I think. At the start it was meh, but after using it a bit I found I like to see multiple algorithms and apps vying to get the shipping accurate. On one order from deep in China, using HK post no less, this was the best app for tracking that item, and it was dead on. Sometimes there’s small discrepancies and that’s up to you to ferret out I guess.
    All in all though, it’s an app that mostly updates itself on orders (looks in your email headers for key words) I believe there’s some oversight there to filter or privacy opt out… not a big worry if mine, once in a while if sent to gmail it won’t scan that and that’s why 4 stars.

title: Trying to force me to use Gmail address
text:
Guess what, folks?  This sounds like a great idea, however...  when I went to create an app I signed up using my Hotmail account as I primarily shop using that.  Then I wanted to add my Yahoo account because that is the other email that is attached to PayPal, which I use on occasion.  Why do I use these two emails, because they each receive about 200+ emails that are nothing but junk every day.  They have been basically ruined for me as any sort of personal account.  I have a Gmail address, but I have kept it STRICTLY for personal correspondence, just to keep the proliferating junk mail from appearing.  So far I have had it a year and not one piece of junk mail, Only email from friends and family to whom I have given the address. 

Now this App is trying to force that email address onto this account, by making me log into Google to add another email and then it is automatically trying to pull in that gmail account.  Not having it.  Won’t be using this app.  I might have given it two stars, but there is no way for me to converse with the developers.

title: Gets hacked too much
text: I’ve used this app a few times, after the first time, different addresses started popping up on my account. I’ve already canceled two credit cards because of fraudulent use on this app. I just got off the phone canceling the third one because someone ordered $500 worth of tennis shoes on my account through this app. If I could post a pic on this review, I’d show that there are two shipping addresses on my account, one in Miami Florida and the other in Hyatsville Maryland. The tennis shoes were ordered in Maryland. There was $300 worth of iron infidel water bottles ordered by the one in Miami. I do not recommend this app and have tried to deleted my account, but, the last person to hack it is using shop pay and it won’t let me delete my account. If you’ve had better luck than me, God bless you. There’s no possible way to get in contact with customer service. Update, just got a notice that another payment method was added to my account. I haven’t added anything and the default address was switched back to the one in Maryland.

title: Fedex delivery was excellent! Product delivered was spot on fantastic!
text:
Product (Goruck GR1 21L Backpack, Black in 1000D) was delivered a day late - 19 April 2022 instead of 18 April 2022 due to local custom duties/taxes inspection and additional information that were required by the custom authorities related to product information, brochure and product specification, but this was quickly resolved through email exchanges between this customer and the local fedex representatives. No additional custom duties/ taxes were imposed aside from what was earlier settled through the website (which was a relief by the way). Otherwise, all is good! Product is great, undamaged and I love it! Thanks fedex for the safe, worry-free and cordial delivery of the item, notwithstanding the CoViD19 pandemic still in effect.  My faith in fedex and the custom authorities of the Philippines is intact! Mabuhay po kayo!
- Allan Ferdinand Valdez Cusi (satisfied customer)

title: Very intuitive
text:
They need to make some integration between the app and perhaps purchases. Maybe by email or by desktop extension so you don’t have to go and input data manually. 

So far I am using this for about a week and it’s a good app that gives you visual updates in one place rather than having to go and track your packages in several different apps, websites, shippers, etc. 

Would highly recommend this app. Looking forward to discovery more features as I use it more often. 

Cool feature is you can just copy a tracking number and once you keep into the homepage of the app, a pop-up will show that it detects new tracking information. Simply, hit the pop-up and it will track the carrier for you. 

The only thing I have a problem with is know what to title the item being tracked. I have so many different merchandise that I lose track of what is being shipped per each tracking number. So it is a little difficult unless the merchant you purchase from has Arrive integrated with their site, then it will show you the actual items being shipped. 

Hope this review helps!

I believe it is free. I haven’t been charged and haven’t come across any features as a user that requires an upgraded version or something like that. 

Go and download the app. You will be happy.

title: Not as amazing as others claim. Better options available.
text:
At first, this tracking app seemed to do its job well. Then I realized that it doesn’t actually work well for deliveries that aren’t your typical, simple, USPS/FedEx/UPS delivery for a couple of reasons (if you have any international shipment, this app seems pretty useless). They do not provide details as to where your package is, and what is happening with your package along the way. They will simply state that it arrived somewhere or departed somewhere. If, during the shipping process, the shipper says that the package has been ‘delivered’ to one of the shippers intermediate locations, the app will mark the package as delivered to you, when it obviously hasn’t been, and stop tracking the shipment. They obviously have some kind of crappy programming that is set up to say the package is delivered anytime the word ‘delivered’ is used. 

At this point, I downloaded another shipment tracking app to compare experiences. The other app was able to provide me clear details about my shipment at every step along the shipment route. It is clear that this app is just terribly developed.

title: Arrive Was So Much Better!
text: I downloaded the Arrive app in early December to track my Christmas packages. It was amazing! All of my package shipping info in one place! They Arrive app would “grab” the shipping information from my email for most of my packages. If it didn’t grab the info, I could go into the app and it would search my emails for shipping info. When I looked at the Arrive app I could see the sender and the arrival date. It was seriously so user friendly and easy to use. The Arrive app just updated to Shop and it’s so disappointing! There are multiple notifications for the same package and the notifications don’t show the sender of package. Since the sender can’t be seen on the main screen I need to go into the package notification, find the tracking number and then find the sender from the shipping website. This is no easier or convenient than searching from my email. With the Arrive app, when a package arrived I could swipe left to archive the notification. This is no longer an option with Shop. So disappointed with the “update”. I will be deleting the shop app.

title: Excellent Tracking tool!!
text:
Finally a way to track all my packages in one app. The great thing is as long as you link the app with the email address that your tracking information was sent to, the app automatically detects it and makes it even easier to add that to your track package page.  No more  having to switch back and forth between email track package links especially if you have multiple items coming. Brilliant app and works great. 
  The only con I found so far is that sometimes you have to choose the delivery carrier out of a suggested list. If the app knows which carrier it might be by making the suggestion in the first place, I feel like it wouldn’t be too hard to let it finish making the choice for you. 
  Even if they don’t fix that, the app works great and that little con isn’t a deal breaker. Just some creative feedback.

title: Teechino's the Best
text: I started drinking Teechino about a month ago. I needed to find a substitute for coffee, so I purchase the sample "Amaretto Coffee" substitute. I have had a bad stomach most of my life and wasn't sure what my problem was. Per doctors advice I stopped all different kinds of food and drinks, with no avail. Until I decided to go off coffee, and use Teechino. You probably think I am full of what makes the grass grow, but honestly my stomach has stopped hurting, not anywhere as much gas as prior, and my gastrointestinal issues have gone away. I will say every once and awhile I will have a decaf coffee, but I really missed my Teechino. I say give it a try, see what flavors floats your boat, then try drinking that without coffee. Give it a honest to goodness chance for a month, I assure, you will enjoy the experience and your belly will be a happy belly. DD

title: Love the app- Saves from the!
text: I love the Shop app. Delivery notifications are real time!!! I hate when FedEx is my carrier they have the most careless delivery person ever!! I have had many bad experiences with them from personal to business deliveries so it is not one sided. They consistently leave packages not in their rightful place where anyone strolling by can nab it. Thanks to this app I have been saved from that as I get the Novocain in real time and run right out to grab my stuff. One delivery was a $400 desk just left outside of my previous residence where anyone driving by with a truck could have thrown it in the back and been gone..... they are seriously the laziest delivery people ever!!!! This app also tracks things that I have bought as gifts so I know things are received or delayed it’s amazing and I recommend 100% 🙌🏽

title: HORRIBLE APP
text:
If I could give it -15 stars ⭐️ I would.  It continuously interferes with PayPal & it always changes the billing information from the actual purchaser to the delivery information.  🤬

I only signed back on to this app, after I had previously deleted it, just so I could leave an honest review & let others know how HORRIBLE this app actually is.  Even after I deleted this app, I’m still getting texts from them “wanting to verify it is really me”.  WHAT??  How could “they” possibly verify it’s me when they override the billing information that I enter on the actual seller’s website.  AND!!  If you haven’t previously entered the delivery person & their address “into their system” they block you from entering the recipient’s address.  When “they” get finished screwing up everything, you are then left with trying to fix their mess.  Just don’t make the same mistake I did,  DO NOT use this app, if you ever want to send something to someone other than yourself.  AND!!  Even then, I suggest you think long & hard before using this app.  JMHO!!

title: Liked the Old Name - simple and easy app to use
text:
Updating to 5 stars after reading how dumb some of these users are.  This app is really awesome.  But the name change is bad.  Arrive was an perfect name for the app.  I am not sure if they got bought out or something but they should have stuck w arrive.  Also the GPS map tracking needs some work. After delivery if you open the map it should show each place your package was with a line between each place and the final destination.  Also it should show in real time where the package is at any given time.
UPDATE: looks like the maps are better with the name change (although arrive was way better)  but still needs the ability to let you move around the map once you open it.  It shows the lines from each place now but you can't move around the map

title: I buy slime
text:
I'm an adult who loves slime. Now hear me out, I'm constantly buying and I hated not being able to know when they're coming. I occasionally got the messages saying they're coming but they were always a bit late or early. That's when I found out about Arrive, and it has changed me life. The apple layout is sleek, easy and so understandable to use. This is my go to to check any updates. I have it synced to my gmail and Outlook and it looks for my purchases without me having to type every single tracking ID in unlike the USPS app. 
As Soo as I make a purchase I select on the site "check on Arrive" and it pops up and will updates me when it is out for delivery and when it has been delivered. Let's say USPS didn't deliver it that same day, it will still let me know that the package has been delayed. I am in love with this app. I am so glad it exists.

title: The best tracking app i’ve ever tried!
text: At first i was kind of skeptical getting this app putting in stuff like my tracking information for my package. I learned about it scrolling through comments on instagram and someone suggested this app as an alternative for a tracking system already put in a clothing app i ordered from. Shop makes me excited to order more items as i get to see where it is at any time. Not only is it fun, it’s very accurate! This app updates before the app i originally bought the clothes from does! The layout is very easy to understand and it super easy to add orders. You can give the orders a custom name and all you need for tracking is your tracking number (obviously), and your carrier. (ex; usps or fedex). I will definitely continue to use this app and suggest it to others.

title: USPS Delivery
text:
Believe this or not but it was delivered a day early. They gave me advance notice that it looked like it would be a day early but I didn’t think so. I was so excited to get my package.  This is a fantastic service. I love knowing when my package will be delivered or where it is. Also it’s just plain fun to see where your package is and knowing when it will be delivered. And believe this or not they are always been on time for delivery if not a day early.  I realize it’s not ARRIVE that keeps it on time they are like we use to call “a tattle take”  . If it’s later than the seller said it should be you know, you are not left in the dark not knowing where your package is   It’s also useful when ARRIVE tells you it’s been delivered but you fit have it, a quicker search can be done. One of your neighbors probably has it. Anyway 
It’s free so try it, you will like ut

title: If you order from various sources you NEED this!!!!
text: I like to order from a lot of different websites so that I can save money, but unfortunately it makes it near impossible for me to keep track of all of my shipments! Until I found the Shop app!!! This thing is genius! My only mistake is not finding it sooner! I depend on this app constantly, it keeps all of my tracking numbers organized together, lets me see where my items are, when they’re arriving, who is delivering them and where the order is coming from. The best thing is, I don’t have to lift a finger! It reads the tracking numbers out of my email! It asks permission to access your emails when you download the app. When you say yes, it simply scans through to look for keywords like various orders and tracking numbers! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

title: Used to be great
text: Before the most recent update the Shop app was great. I have recommended it to many people to track packages but now I am looking for a new app to do this with. The most recent update makes your home page, the one you go to as soon as you open the app, an ads page basically. You have to click through to get to your actual package tracking. Yes, ads are to “help you shop” from websites you’ve already purchased from but that’s a pain. If I wanted advertising I would have gone elsewhere. I sent a message through the Shop contact form to ask about this issue (it is extremely hard to figure out how to contact Shop directly without going through social media) and the server was down. Imagine that. The app wanted me to retype the whole thing so I came here instead and left a review. I shouldn’t have to dig for customer support contacts or click through from a shopping page to track orders if that is what the app is about.

title: Useless
text: First time I used Arrive it cancelled my order. Had to reorder and didn’t need the products anymore by the time they finally arrived. Second time and third time it detected some of my orders from gmail but offered zero tracking info. Yes, all notification were turned on in settings. I have an order out now but when I select it in the Arrive  app all I get is an option to contact retailer or shop. The “shop” option, (without even selecting it) shows lots of products from the company I’ve already ordered from so as far as I can tell this app is nothing more than additional advertising for companies I’m already ordering from. Brilliant. I’m deleting it for the third time and won’t bother trying to use it again. This is hands down the worst app I’ve ever encountered. Disappointing.

title: Concept could have been cool, but...
text:
The concept is cool that I can find LOCAL and other SmallBiz shops that have a Shopify platform site, but everything is based on delivery addresses. Why? Also the stores aren’t really listed... it’s just a link to the stores site... why not? Why not allow me to pick a location to find local shops and shop it? Also being locked into a payment method is kind of lame. How many of these things can all these companies have? Just get onboard with Google/Apple Pay already. The idea has so much potential to help small businesses on the Shopify platform, but it feels too much like a walled garden and a money grab. 

The concept of following your local stores and other non-local business stores would have been awesome. The social media approach to following and then having their own page is cool... giving some ideas here! Maybe if the platform would help these small business grow into the higher tier subscriptions, then you wouldn’t have to worry about the payment income. Just saying!

title: Tracking my packages is so much easier!
text: I wanted to try out an app that would make tracking my packages easier. I found this app and saw the reviews saying it was good so I downloaded it. Let me say this app has helped a lot. I’ve had this app for about half a year already. I used to go onto my gmail or the website I ordered from for any shipping updates. With this app I can just go on and it shows me. The great thing is that when you order something the app will automatically find it most of the time, if not you can just manually put it on. Something that I enjoy is going into the app and seeing multiple packages and their location rather than going to individually check it each one, it’s so much less time consuming and functional! I would definitely recommend this app to track packages!

title: this app is worthless
text: The Shop app does not track your orders or have the correct status of where your order is and when it's delivered you have to mark it delivered yourself bcuz the app apparently cannot tell when your order hd been delivered. so what is the point of this app? I'll tell you absolutely f****ng nothing. this app does not correct its issues and the customer service is booty cheeks. oh and don't count on any of the shop promise(s). they don't honor them and customer service will find an excuse not to give you compensation for their shop promise. this app is just a way to scan ur emails, track YOU and be all up in your business. it literally asks to have access to your emails to use the app. the worst part is they allow scammer sellers on their platform and don't do anything about it. i got screwed out of money in the app ...the app is supposed to be safe... its not!! fraudulent sellers selling fraudulent things and customer service yet again does nothing. don't waste your time using this app . y'all been warned!

title: If I could could give a zero.…
text: I’m very frustrated with this app. I ordered from one of its vendors and the message said “order is being processed”.  The funds were debited the very next day. No shipping service was specified so I can’t track it, and neither the vendor nor Shop pay itself has resolved my missing order. I keep getting messages about the server not being valid, and I have reached out to Shop pay to no avail. I have received neither the order nor the refund. When Shoppay did answer my email, they said to contact the vendor. How can I contact the vendor if I keep getting error messages??? I feel like I’ve been scammed on this order. Disgusted with vendor and with Shop pay for ignoring my repeated requests for a resolution. I can’t report the Vendor to the BBB because there’s no record of this company on file. After getting the phone number of the vendor, I’ve left several messages with voice mail but no one answers. Anyone else have this issue with other vendors on Shop pay or Shop pay themselves?

title: Good, but latent accuracy and no reset for mislabeling
text:
Arrive is a good app. I like the fact it establishes a folder in email to directly transfer shipment info to pull tracking information . However, it reports delivery status anywhere from an hour to a day late. I have had packages out for delivery that Arrive still tells me they are in transit; and packages that have already been delivered that Arrive tells 2hrs after it has been delivered. 
Biggest problem, and despite saying they're correcting it, they STILL have failed to address in every update is that there is no way to correct it if accidentally label an order 'marked delivered'. You can't revert it, so the tracking is lost to the ether. 
Fix it!  
The best thing, and probably the least concern of anyone else that that uses this app cares about, is that it puts up pictures of what you ordered; so now I do not have to write it myself to remember which numbers go with which orders. Kudos on pulling that off!

title: Used to be 5-star, but company has introduced ads and extra clicks
text: Used to be a 5-star package-tracking app, now I’m on the hunt for another to replace it. Why? Because all great free-apps they get greedy and this one is no different, recent updates have introduced a new forced on you start page that shows extremely limited tracking information, along with “Shops you love” and “Featured curations” (aka advertising). There is no way to change the default start page and it requires extra clicks to get back to the original “View All Order Tracking” which is what I want to see as my default start page when I launch the app. This app used to be quick to pop open and see the status of all my packages, not any more. There are plenty of ad-based great tracking apps, I want to find another one that doesn’t force it on me and I don’t expect them to change back so I’m looking elsewhere.

title: Was this app written by children?
text: Seriously, have these people ever shopped online because it doesn’t seem like it. This app has a good premise, but there is always something unnecessarily annoying that happens. The biggest problem is that it auto fills the previous shipping address and is horrible at showing the user what the app selected as the default addresses, so I bought a gift for someone and then my next purchase was shipped to their house, too. And there is no obvious button to change the default shipping address. It also took way too long to figure out how to update my own address when I moved. Their international tracking is basically nonexistent. The cash back/credit program is a joke — who is encouraged to shop because you have a random $2 credit. Shipping costs more than that. Finally, there is no easy way to send feedback in the app. I HATE that small businesses use this app and am going to look to shop at businesses that use alternative shipping partners from now on.

title: Needs notification time frames
text:
I deleted the app. I downloaded it mainly because the company I ordered from told me this was the app they used to track deliveries. Since it was a high priced purchase I did. Now I am wondering if it actually was the company or an ad that happened to pop up after I used my method of payment. 
The tracking is also being provided by the store and the shipping company. I didn’t know the store was going to send notifications too. The shop app was a third notification means. I didn’t mind until I started getting notifications in the middle of the night waking the family. The app needs to have a “do not disturb” time frame. I shop through the actual shops and stores apps. I don’t need a 3rd party app using my phone space.
I wish I knew if this was an ad I fell for or if it was the store I ordered from telling me I needed to download the app to track my shipment.

title: Super Convenient
text:
At first I wasn’t sure this app would be any different than the rest of the ‘tracking’ apps. However I gave it a shot anyway and was pleasantly surprised. It’s really convenient to have the ability to see all your shipments either coming or going. It does so automatically, from all shipping companies big or small even online print and ship establishments. One feature I really enjoy is the ability to view a live real map of the shipments progress to its destinations. Overall I highly recommend this app for all your package tracking needs. 
The only thing I would like to see in the future is, faster updates. Sometimes the information is a bit slow to receive especially for USPS. This is however a minimal issue and can look past it for now. 
Keep up the great work Arrive team!
 💯🌟⭐️🌟⭐️🌟🔥🔥🔥

title: It’s like spyware that you agree to use
text: I gave the Shop app one star because the app will not tell you what you need to know unless you  give the Shop app access to your email messages and settings, manage mailboxes and labels, and manage your basic email settings. Why is all of this necessary?  The app was able to find my order number, tell me what I ordered, tell me how much I paid, and show me my home address.  But the one thing it won’t show me is tracking information unless I agree to let the app have unfettered access to my email and settings.  A US Postal Service tracking number is all I need.  I can’t even get that and the vendor hasn’t responded yet either.  This app is a data vampire that asks you to invite it in and holds the information, that you actually need, hostage until you let it in.  I shouldn’t have to choose between privacy and a simple shipping update.  Since the vendor isn’t responding and all I was provided was a link to get the app, I guess I just don’t get updates.

title: It’s ok but not as good as other parcel tracking apps
text:
It sets out to do what it should do track a package. Then it sorta falls short of what it could be. Before anyone jumps up and down (looking at you dev) other apps are pulling the same data from the same place. For example, both Deliveries and Parcel are pulling data from USPS just like Arrive is. Yet today I had three packages show up via USPS. Both Deliveries and Parcel (Parcel first and Deliveries 2 mins later) tell me they had arrived. This was three hours ago. Arrive has yet to alert me. This isn’t the first time. Since this was a “multi hop” trip for these items the other two tracking apps where always two to four hours ahead of what Arrive would say.

If you want just a ballpark idea of when your package will show up and you like the Gmail integration (not a big deal for me I can cut and paste tracking numbers) than Arrive is ok. If you want something more precise this is not your app.

title: Privacy and security nightmare that needs WAY too much access to your email
text:
I’m not sure if anyone has actually read the things Arrive can do when you give it access to your email? By agreeing to give it access to scan your emails you’re also gifting Arrive the following:
It can change your name and send-from address (ie it can spoof your email). It can change your POP and IMAP settings meaning they can redirect your outgoing mail without you knowing. The POP settings means they can remote scrape your email on their own servers.
Arrive is a great idea but it requires WAY too much access to your gmail account to be worth the risk. All it should require is read access. To give it all the other things is a privacy nightmare. 
The help online says it can be used without being connected to an email account for scanning, but during setup you’ll discover it can’t. You either give it full access to your gmail, or you don’t use it at all. 
If you’re even faintly concerned about your email security, you’d be wise to steer well clear of this.

title: DON’T MAKE THE MISTAKE I DID
text: I ordered a pair of plain gray shark slides for my son for his birthday. I paid for 3-5 day shipping. The package didn’t get to post office until the 4th day it was supposed to be on its way. I then contacted this company at least 3 times via email, prob more to find out what was going on cause the tracking kept saying it was still sitting at post office and hadn’t even been shipped yet. I asked the company through email to cancel the order due to the fact that the package wasn’t even taken to a post office until 4th day of shipping on its way to me, which it wasn’t. No word back from company after multiple emails. Package gets to me almost 3 weeks later, guess what??? It wasn’t what I even ordered!!!!! They sent me glitter gray ones!!!!! I ordered plain gray. My son was so let down. Thanks to this company. Don’t make the same mistake I did. Big disappointment for this company and I won’t be purchasing anything else because of how it was handled, which was just to ignore the customer!! Unfair and not right.
